content: How did you create this backup? Thunderbird doesn't create backups on its own. If you created a new profile, the old one should be in the Profiles folder at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles
creator: davidsk

content: It may help to see screenshots of your 'copies&folders' pane for each account. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Check the online account to confirm that the messages are being deleted. If so, then the PC is likely a POP setup that is downloading and leaving on server. A check of the setup will clarify this.
creator: davidsk

content: Seeing a screenshot of the account folders within the imapmail and mail folders may help. Sometimes, compacting fails and leaves detritus that can be readily removed. I make that request because my inference is that the large disk usage is due to the accounts,
creator: davidsk
